results.title: A Day at the races
results.creator_credit: Sam Wood, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. The plot, which shifts from a sanitorium to a race track, introduces a horse doctor masquerading as sanitorium director, a jockey who encourages his horse to win by showing it a picture of the man it hates, a vendor of bad racing tips and a vampire dressed in revealing clothing. Also stars Maureen O’Sullivan.
results.description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. results.title: Apples and pears: the Australian story
results.brief_description: Focuses on the story of apple and pear production in Australia from fruitgrower to exporter, and is supplemented by a comprehensive teachers guide which provides an interesting approach to effective use of the video material - planning an advertising campaign.
results.description: Focuses on the story of apple and pear production in Australia from fruitgrower to exporter, and is supplemented by a comprehensive teachers guide which provides an interesting approach to effective use of the video material - planning an advertising campaign.

results.title: Fast talking
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Ross Matthews, AFI [au] and Old Data
results.brief_description: An Australian feature film that presents the story of fifteen year old Steve Carson, a con artist, spirited rebel and determined survivor in the face of crumbling family relationships. The many influences in his life are highlighted in a comedy of fast dialogue and outrageous escapades. Starring Rod Zuanic, Toni Allaylis, Chris Truswell, Gail Sweeny and Steve Bisley.

results.title: The Chosen
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Edie Landau, Ely Landau and Chosen Film Company
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Chaim Potok which explores the friendship that develops between two adolescent Jewish boys living in New York in the 1940s. The boys are from vastly different Jewish backgrounds, one being an Hasidic Jew and the other a Zionist. Features Rod Steiger, Maximilian Schell as the boys fathers together with Robby Benson and Barry Miller.

results.title: History's a snap: Australia as Australians saw it
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Examines the value of the ordinary snapshot over the years and the role it has played in detailing the history of the State of Victoria.

results.title: Writing, plain and fancy
results.creator_credit: Mallory Pearce, Severo Perez and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Surveys the evolution of written communication. Beginning with the Romans and their invention of capital letters, the program continues through the reign of the great King Charlemagne who standardized the alphabet. The importance of legible writing for good communication is stressed. Narrated by John Houseman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mallory Pearce, Severo Perez and Walt Disney Productions

results.title: Destination: science
results.creator_credit: Fern Field, EPCOT Educational Media and Focal Video
results.brief_description: Combines animation and live action as Donald Duck is invited to tour the world of science beyond the laboratory. Flight, the electric light bulb and computers are used to illustrate the relevance of inquiry and discovery in our daily lives. Part of the series “Journey to tomorrow”.

results.title: The Challenge of survival: chemicals
results.creator_credit: Paul Gerber, Dick Young Productions and EPCOT Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows how advances in agricultural research have increased our crop yields but have at the same time created a serious threat to our natural resources. Illustrates how our current use of chemicals has led to the poisoning of the environment and resistance developed amongst some pests. Examines alternative methods of pest management. Narrated by Michael Kane.

results.title: Waltzing Matilda: touring Australia
results.brief_description: A tourist promotion that intermingles aspects of Australian history and culture with holiday promotion. Narrated by Charles Tingwell with original music by Bruce Smeaton. The song “Walzing Matilda” played by the Bushwackers Band is used as a theme.
